title: Print, "The Chestnut Hall [La Salle Aux Marronniers]"
description:
Print of people out on a day in the park leisurely walking and conversing.  In image there is a wide path line down either side with trellises covered in vines and trees.  Along the walls are busts sitting on pedestals.  

At bottom it says:
"Tranquility is the freshness in the greater heat of the east, making the grove one of the most charming places in the Gardens of Versailles.  It is enclosed by a magnificent trellis, decorated with beautiful busts of Porphyry and white marble statues."

[La tranquillité et la fraicheur dans les plus grandes chateurs de l’Este rendent ce Bosquet vin des plus charmant. Endroits de Jardin de Versailles. Il est en-fermé par un Magnifiq treillage, orne de beaux Bustes de Porphire, et Statues de Mabré blanc. ]

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "The Chestnut Hall [La Salle Aux Marronniers]".
Gift of Unknown Donor. 1980-32-1489.
